tasks.title: Redesign NotifyMe Account/Settings Page UI for Improved Scannability and Hierarchy
tasks.description: Redesign the NotifyMe Account/Settings page to enhance visual hierarchy, grouping, and scannability while preserving all existing functionality and adhering to established design patterns.
tasks.details:
1. Analyze the current Account/Settings page to inventory all existing features and settings, ensuring no functional regressions.
2. Implement the new structure:
   - Profile Section: Business name, phone, address, timezone (always visible)
   - Booking Defaults: Default duration, appointment type presets, duration presets
   - Booking Behavior: Require confirmation switch, external booking system toggle
   - Working Hours: 7-day schedule with collapsible rows
   - Integrations: Calendar integration (Google)
   - Billing: Subscription management
   - Developer Tools: Move SMS test buttons to a hidden, collapsible section at the bottom
3. Use NotifyMe’s established card layout, spacing, and typography for consistency.
4. Remove the accordion for core settings; use clear section headings and grouping to improve scanability and reduce cognitive load.
5. Apply a mobile-first responsive design using modern CSS (Flexbox/Grid, media queries) and test on real devices.
6. Ensure all interactive elements are accessible (keyboard navigation, ARIA labels, sufficient contrast, focus states).
7. Preserve the global save button pattern and ensure all settings changes are handled identically to the current implementation.
8. Collaborate with QA and stakeholders to review the new layout for usability and adherence to design system.
9. Update or add Storybook stories and documentation for new/modified components.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Regression test all settings: verify that all existing settings (business info, booking, working hours, integrations, billing, developer tools) are present and function identically to the current implementation.
2. UI/UX review: Confirm improved visual hierarchy, grouping, and scanability on both desktop and mobile. Validate that important settings are no longer hidden and developer tools are separated.
3. Responsive testing: Test on a range of devices and browsers to ensure layout adapts smoothly and remains usable.
4. Accessibility audit: Use tools (e.g., axe, Lighthouse) and manual keyboard navigation to confirm compliance with WCAG 2.1 AA standards.
5. Design system compliance: Review with design team to ensure cards, spacing, and typography match NotifyMe patterns.
6. User acceptance testing: Conduct usability sessions with internal users to validate the new structure and gather feedback.

tasks.title: Apply UX/UI Refinements to NotifyMe Account Page Based on Product Feedback
tasks.description: Implement layout and visual refinements to the redesigned NotifyMe Account Page, addressing product feedback to improve logical grouping, consistency, and UI clarity without altering existing functionality.
tasks.details:
1. Move the 'Working Hours' section into the 'Business Profile' area as a collapsible subsection, ensuring it is visually subordinate and logically grouped with other core business configuration elements. Use a standard accordion or disclosure pattern for collapsibility, maintaining accessibility and keyboard navigation support.
2. Relocate the 'Use External Booking System' toggle from the 'Booking Behavior' section to the 'Integrations' section. Update section headers and ensure the toggle's state and behavior remain unchanged. The 'Booking Behavior' section should retain only the 'Require Manual Confirmation' toggle.
3. Audit the 'Manage Billing' button to ensure it uses the standard button component from the design system. Verify that hover, focus, and active states match the established button variant, and update styles if inconsistencies are found.
4. Review all changes for visual consistency, alignment, and adherence to the design system. No changes to underlying logic or data flow are permitted—this is a purely presentational update.
5. Update any relevant UI documentation or component usage notes to reflect the new layout and grouping.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Visual regression testing: Compare before/after screenshots of the Account Page to confirm that only the specified layout and visual changes are present, with no functional regressions.
2. Manual UI walkthrough: Verify that 'Working Hours' is now a collapsible subsection within 'Business Profile', and that it expands/collapses correctly with keyboard and mouse.
3. Confirm that the 'Use External Booking System' toggle appears only in the 'Integrations' section and functions as before; ensure 'Booking Behavior' contains only the 'Require Manual Confirmation' toggle.
4. Inspect the 'Manage Billing' button for correct variant, hover, focus, and active states using browser dev tools and keyboard navigation.
5. Cross-browser and device testing: Ensure layout and interactions are consistent across supported browsers and screen sizes.
6. Accessibility check: Confirm that all interactive elements (collapsible sections, toggles, buttons) are accessible via keyboard and have appropriate ARIA attributes.
